Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Anatomy Lessons
Talent.Description: After a successful attack with a personal (non-starship/ vehicle) weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Intellect to one hit of the attack.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: All-Terrain Driver
Talent.Description: When piloting a vehicle using the Piloting (Planetary) skill, the character does not suffer the penalties for driving through difficult terrain.

Talent.Name: Armor Master
Talent.Description: When wearing armor, the character increases his total soak value by one.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Armor Master (Improved)
Talent.Description: When wearing armor with a soak value of two or higher, the character increases his defense by one.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Bacta Specialist
Talent.Description: Patients under the character's supervision heal one additional wound per rank of Bacta Specialist each time they heal a wound while recovering in a bacta tank or under supervised medical conditions or long-term care.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Bad Motivator
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may take a Bad Motivator action to make a Hard [DI] [DI] [DI] Mechanics check. If successful, one device (subject to the GM's approval) spontaneously fails due to the character's involvement, or because it was about to fail anyway and the character noticed it (this is the character's decision).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Balance
Talent.Description: Force Talent. When the character recovers from strain at the end of each encounter, he may roll his Force rating in Force dice. He recovers additional strain equal to the [LI] rolled.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Barrage
Talent.Description: Please see page 132 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 34 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook, for details.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Basic Combat Training
Talent.Description: Brawl and Ranged (Light) become career skills.

Talent.Name: Black Market Contacts
Talent.Description: Please see page 132 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
Talent.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Blooded
Talent.Description: The character adds [BO] per rank of Blooded to his checks to resist or recover from the effects of poisons, venoms, and other toxins. Reduce the duration of any related ongoing effects or damage from toxins, venoms, or poisons by one round per rank of Blooded to a minimum of one.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Body Guard
Talent.Description: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Body Guard maneuver to protect one ally with whom he is engaged. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Body Guard. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting the protected ally a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Bought Info
Talent.Description: When required to make a Knowledge skill check, the character can instead make a Bought Info action. He spends a number of credits equal to 50 times the difficulty of the check and counts as succeeding on the check with one uncanceled [SU] . At the GM's discretion, the character may not be able to use this ability if the information sought is particularly hard to find, or if the character is in a situation where he could not purchase information (such as marooned on a planet with no access to the HoloNet).

Talent.Name: Brace
Talent.Description: As a maneuver, the character may Brace himself. This allows a character to remove [SE] per rank of Brace from the next skill check based on changing conditions, inclement weather, unstable surfaces, zero gravity, heavy gravity, or other disruptive physical obstacles that would make skill check more difficult.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Brilliant Evasion
Talent.Description: The character may make the Brilliant Evasion action when piloting a vehicle or starship. The character selects one opponent and makes an opposed Piloting (Planetary or Space) check. If he succeeds, the opponent's vehicle or starship cannot make any attacks against the character's vehicle for a number of rounds equal to the character's Agility. Brilliant Evasion can only be performed once per encounter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Bypass Security
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Bypass Security from his Skulduggery and Computers skill checks made to disable a security device or open locked door.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Careful Planning
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character can choose to introduce a "fact" or additional context directly into the narrative as if he had spent a Destiny Point.

Talent.Name: Clever Solution
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Cunning, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his cunning is helping him overcome this challenge.

Talent.Name: Codebreaker
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Codebreaker from his attempts to break codes or decrypt communications. In addition, the character decreases the difficulty of his Computers or Intellect checks made to break codes or decrypt communications by one (this does not increase with additional ranks of Codebreaker).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Command
Talent.Description: The character gains [BO] per rank of Command when making Leadership checks (or other checks to inspire, lead, or rally an audience). Inspired targets also add [BO] per rank to any subsequent Discipline checks they make over the next twenty-four hours (this does not increase with additional ranks of Command).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Commanding Presence
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Commanding Presence from his Leadership and Cool checks.

Talent.Name: Confidence
Talent.Description: The character may decrease the difficulty of any Discipline check to avoid the effects of fear by one per rank of Confidence. If he decreases the difficulty to zero, he does not have to make a Discipline check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Contraption
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character can take a Contraption action. With a successful Hard [DI] [DI] [DI] Mechanics check, the character can fashion a device to solve a current problem using the tools and parts on hand. This device must be approved by the GM and functions for the duration of the current encounter only. Those tools are destroyed in the process. may be spent to allow the tools to be recovered to be reused later.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Convincing Demeanor
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Convincing Demeanor from his Deception and Skulduggery checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Coordinated Assault
Talent.Description: The character may make a Coordinated Assault maneuver. If he does so, a number of allies engaged with him equal to his ranks in Leadership gain [AD] on combat checks they make until the beginning of the character's next turn. The range of this maneuver increases by one band per rank of Coordinated Assault.

Talent.Name: Creative Killer
Talent.Description: The character reduces the critical rating of all improvised weapons he is wielding by 2 (to a minimum of 1).

Talent.Name: Crippling Blow
Talent.Description: The character may voluntarily increase the difficulty of a combat check by one to deal a crippling blow. If he succeeds and deals damage to the target's wound threshold, the target suffers one strain whenever he moves for the remainder of the encounter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Dead to Rights
Talent.Description: The character may spend one Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to half his Agility rating (rounded up) to one hit of a successful attack made by ship or vehicle-mounted weaponry.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Dead to Rights (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may spend one Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to his Agility rating to one hit of a successful attack made by ship or vehiclemounted weaponry. This replaces the normal ability for Dead to Rights.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Deadly Accuracy
Talent.Description: Each time the character gains a rank of Deadly Accuracy, he must choose one combat skill. The character may add his basic training ranks in that combat skill as additional damage to one hit of a successful attack made with that skill with non-starship/vehicle weapons. He cannot choose the same combat skill twice.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Debilitating Shot
Talent.Description: Upon making a successful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, may spend O O to reduce the maximum speed of the target by 1 (to a minimum of 1) until the end of the next round. If the starship or vehicle was traveling its maximum speed, it has its current speed reduced to the new maximum.

Talent.Name: Dedication
Talent.Description: Each rank permanently increases a single characteristic of the player's choice by one point. This cannot bring a characteristic above six.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Defensive Driving
Talent.Description: Any vehicle the character pilots has its defense rating on all zones increased by one per rank of Defensive Driving.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Defensive Slicing
Talent.Description: When attempting to defend a computer system against intrusion (or when an opponent attempts to slice a computer owned or programmed by the character), the character adds [SE] per rank of Defensive Slicing to his opponent's checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Defensive Slicing (Improved)
Talent.Description: When attempting to defend a computer system against intrusion, the character upgrades the difficulty of an opponent's dice pool a number of times equal to his rank of Defensive Slicing. This replaces the usual benefits from Defensive Slicing.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Defensive Stance
Talent.Description: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Defensive Stance maneuver to defend against incoming melee attacks. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Defensive Stance. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all melee combat checks targeting the character a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character in this way.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Disorient
Talent.Description: After hitting with a combat check, the character may spend [AD] [AD] to disorient his foe (see page 230). Disoriented targets add [SE] to all skill checks. The target is disoriented for a number of rounds equal to the attacker's ranks in Disorient.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Dodge
Talent.Description: When targeted by a combat check (ranged or melee) the character may choose to immediately perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain, then upgrade the difficulty of the combat check by that number. The number of strain suffered cannot exceed his ranks in Dodge.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Durable
Talent.Description: The character may reduce a Critical Injury result he suffers by 10 per rank of Durable, to a minimum of one.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Dynamic Fire
Talent.Description: When making a ranged attack while engaged with an opponent, the character may suffer 2 strain to reduce the ranged modifier added for being engaged by 1 for the attack. So, when firing a Ranged (Heavy) weapon, the character only increases the difficulty by 1 when engaged, and when firing a Ranged (Light) weapon, he doesn't increase the difficulty at all.

Talent.Name: Enduring
Talent.Description: The character gains + 1 soak value per rank of Enduring

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Exhaust Port
Talent.Description: Before attacking a starship or vehicle, the character may spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore the effects of the Massive rule for the attack.

Talent.Name: Expert Tracker
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Expert Tracker from his checks to find or follow tracks. Survival checks made to track targets take 50% less time than normal (this does not decrease with additional ranks of Expert Tracker).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Familiar Suns
Talent.Description: Once per game session the character may spend a maneuver to make a Hard [DI] [DI] [DI] Knowledge (Outer Rim) or Knowledge (Core Worlds) check If successful, the character is familiar with the type of planetary environment in which he finds himself. He knows whether the planet is likely to be inhabited and, if so, where habitation could be found. He also knows about environmental effects, hostile predators, or potential base locations.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Feral Strength
Talent.Description: The character adds 1 damage per rank of Feral Strength to one hit of his successful Brawl and Melee attacks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Field Commander
Talent.Description: The character may take a Field Commander action. By successfully passing an Average [DI] [DI] Leadership check, a number of allies equal to his Presence may immediately suffer one strain to perform one maneuver. This does not count against the number of maneuvers they may perform in their turn. If there are any questions as to the order in which allies act, the character using Field Commander is the final arbiter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Field Commander (Improved)
Talent.Description: When taking a Field Commander action, the character may affect allies equal to twice his Presence. In addition, he may spend [TR] generated on his Leadership checks to allow one ally to suffer one strain to perform an action, rather than a maneuver.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Fine Tuning
Talent.Description: Whenever the character repairs system strain on a starship or vehicle, he repairs one additional system strain per rank of Fine Tuning

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Fire Control
Talent.Description: When in a starship or vehicle, the character can make a Fire Control maneuver. If he does so, all combat checks from the starship or vehicle count the silhouette of the target as one higher than normal until the beginning of the character's next turn. This effect does not stack with multiple uses of the Fire Control maneuver.

Talent.Name: Forager
Talent.Description: The character removes up to [SE] [SE] from his skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the time.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Force of Will
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Willpower, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his willpower is helping him overcome this challenge.

Talent.Name: Force Rating
Talent.Description: Force-Sensitive Emergent Force Talent. Each rank permanently increases the character's Force rating by one.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Form On Me
Talent.Description: When the character performs the Gain the Advantage action (see page 247), a number of allied vehicles equal to his ranks in Leadership and within close range also gain the benefits of the action on the target. These allied vehicles maintain the benefits until they leave close range with the character or the character loses the benefits of Gain the Advantage.

Talent.Name: Frenzied Attack
Talent.Description: When making a Melee or Brawl combat check, the character may suffer a number of strain, then upgrade the ability of his combat check by that number. This number cannot exceed his ranks in Frenzied Attack.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Full Stop
Talent.Description: When piloting a ship or vehicle, the character may take the Full Stop maneuver to immediately reduce the speed of the ship or vehicle to zero. The ship or vehicle then suffers one point of system strain for every point of speed it had before stopping.

Talent.Name: Full Throttle
Talent.Description: The character may push a ship or vehicle past its limits of speed. He may perform the Full Throttle action, attempting a Hard [DI] [DI] [DI] Piloting check. With success, the ship's top speed increases by one for a number of rounds equal to Cunning. The ship still cannot perform actions or maneuvers it could not perform normally (e.g., actions that have a minimum speed requirement).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Full Throttle (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may voluntarily suffer one strain to attempt Full Throttle as a maneuver. In addition, the difficulty of Full Throttle is reduced to Average [DI] [DI]

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Full Throttle (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When the character successfully performs Full Throttle, the ship's top speed increases by two for a number of rounds equal to his Cunning, instead of one.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Galaxy Mapper
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Galaxy Mapper from his Astrogation checks. In addition, Astrogation checks take 50% less time (this does not increase with additional ranks of Galaxy Mapper).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Gearhead
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Gearhead from his Mechanics checks. In addition, the credit cost to add mods to attachments decreases by 50% (this does not increase with additional ranks of Gearhead).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Greased Palms
Talent.Description: Before making a social interaction check, the character may perform a Greased Palms maneuver and spend up to 50 credits per rank of Greased palms. For every 50 credits spent, the character upgrades the ability of the skill check once. How the money accomplishes this can be up to the player and GM, but could take the form of bribes, buying gifts, or even purchasing information that gives the character an advantage in the ensuing interaction.

Talent.Name: Grit
Talent.Description: Each rank of Grit increases a character's strain threshold by one.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hard Headed
Talent.Description: On any turn in which the character is staggered or disoriented, he may perform the Hard Headed action (this action may be specifically performed even though he is normally barred from performing actions when staggered). He makes a Daunting [DI] [DI] [DI] [DI] Discipline check. If he succeeds, he is no longer staggered or disoriented. The difficulty of this check decreases by one per additional rank of Hard Headed, to a minimum of Easy [DI]

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hard Headed (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may use his Hard Headed action to recover from being incapacitated due to exceeding his strain threshold. On his next turn after being incapacitated, he may make a Formidable ( [DI] [DI] [DI] [DI] [DI] ) Discipline check as his Hard Headed action (this action can specifically be performed even though he is normally barred from performing actions). If he succeeds, decrease his strain to one below his strain threshold. The difficulty of this check decreases by one per rank of Hard Headed, to a minimum of Easy [DI]

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Heightened Awareness
Talent.Description: Allies within short range of the character add [BO] to their Perception and Vigilance checks. Allies engaged with him add [BO] [BO] instead.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Heroic Fortitude
Talent.Description: The character may spend one Destiny Point to ignore the effects of ongoing Critical Injuries on any Brawn- or Agility-related checks until the end of the encounter. He still suffers from the injury itself.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hidden Storage
Talent.Description: Any large equipment, vehicle, or droid that the character owns has one or more hidden compartments for smuggling appropriately sized gear. The number of compartments is up to the player, but cannot be enough to hold a total encumbrance value of items more than the character's ranks in Hidden Storage. The size of the compartments are proportional to the size of the vehicle or droid in question. Most humanoid droids can only hold items equivalent in size to a one-handed weapon, whereas a silhouette 4 starship could conceal humanoids within its compartments. Any checks to detect these compartments have a Formidable [DI] [DI] [DI] [DI] [DI] difficulty.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hold Together
Talent.Description: The character may spend one Destiny Point to make a Hold Together incidental immediately after a vehicle or starship he has repaired this encounter takes damage resulting in hull trauma. The character explains why the apparently serious damage was in fact superficial, and the damage from the attack becomes system strain instead.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hunter
Talent.Description: Please see page 137 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 145 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Incite Rebellion
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character can take an Incite Rebellion action to make a Hard [DI] [DI] [DI] Coercion check. If successful, a number of beings up to his ranks in Coercion become unhappy and try to take action against an organization or authority with power over them until the end of the encounter. This could be due to something the character did or said, or just because the beings were already unhappy with their position.

Talent.Name: Indistinguishable
Talent.Description: The character's appearance is so common that people have a hard time identifying distinguishing traits. Opposing characters upgrade the difficulty of any checks made to identify him once per rank of Indistinguishable.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Insight
Talent.Description: Force Talent. Perception and Discipline become career skills.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Inspiring Rhetoric
Talent.Description: The character may take the Inspiring Rhetoric action; making an Average [DI] [DI] Leadership check. For each [SU] one ally within close range recovers one strain. For each [AD] , one ally benefiting from Inspiring Rhetoric recovers one additional strain.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Inspiring Rhetoric (Improved)
Talent.Description: Each ally affected by Inspiring Rhetoric gains [BO] on a skill checks for a number of rounds equal to the character's ranks in Leadership; this does not stack with itself.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Inspiring Rhetoric (Supreme)
Talent.Description: The character may voluntarily suffer 1 strain to perform Inspiring Rhetoric as a maneuver instead of an action

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Intense Focus
Talent.Description: Before making a skill check, the character may perform the Intense Focus maneuver. The character suffers one strain to upgrade the ability of the skill check once.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Intense Presence
Talent.Description: The character may spend one Destiny Point to recover strain equal to his Presence rating.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Intimidating
Talent.Description: When attempting a Coercion check, the character may suffer a number of strain to downgrade the difficulty of the check a number of times equal to the strain suffered. This number cannot exceed his ranks in Intimidating. When the character is the target of a Coercion check, the character may suffer a number of strain to upgrade the difficulty of the check a number of times equal to the strain suffered. This number cannot exceed his ranks in Intimidating.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Inventor
Talent.Description: When constructing new items or modifying existing attachments (see Chapter V: Gear and Equipment), the character may choose to add [BO] or remove [SE] from the check per rank of Inventor.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Invigorate
Talent.Description: Force Talent. Once per encounter, when an ally within short range attempts a skill check using the Brawn or Agility characteristic, the character may roll [FO]. Each [LI] adds [SU] to the target's check; however, each [DA] adds [SE] to the target's check.

Talent.Name: It's Not that Bad
Talent.Description: Once per game session, when an ally is about to suffer a critical injury, the character can take an It's Not That Bad incidental to make a Hard [DI] [DI] [DI] Medicine check. If successful, the ally does not gain the Critical Injury and does not suffer any of its normal effects (although the attack that caused the Critical Injury still deals its damage as normal).

Talent.Name: Jump Up
Talent.Description: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may stand up from prone or a seated position as an Incidental.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Jury Rigged
Talent.Description: The character chooses one personal weapon or piece of armor per rank of Jury Rigged. He may increase the damage of the weapon by one; decrease the Advantage cost on its Critical, or any single other effect by one to a minimum of one; or increase armor's ranged or melee defense by one. Alternatively, he can decrease the encumbrance of the item by two to a minimum of one. The bonus only applies so long as the character is using the item. If the item is ever lost or destroyed, the character may apply Jury Rigged to a new personal weapon or piece or armor.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Kill With Kindness
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Kill with Kindness from his Charm and Leadership checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Knockdown
Talent.Description: After hitting with a melee attack, the character may knock the target prone by spending a [TR]. If the target is larger than the acting character, it requires one additional [TR] for each silhouette larger.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Know Somebody
Talent.Description: Once per game session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, the character may reduce its rarity by one step per rank of Know Somebody.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Knowledge Specialization
Talent.Description: When the character first acquires this talent, he may choose one Knowledge skill. When making checks with that skill, he may spend [TR] to gain additional [SU] equal to his ranks in Knowledge Specialization.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Known Schematic
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may spend a maneuver to make a Hard [DI] [DI] [DI] Knowledge (Education) check Success means he is familiar with a building or capital ship's design. He now knows the location of critical components or facilities within the ship or vehicle, as well as his own location. He can also plan unconventional routes around obstacles. Additional [AD], [SU] or [TR] results can reveal other useful information at the GM's discretion.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Let's Ride
Talent.Description: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may mount or dismount from a vehicle or beast, or slide into the cockpit or weapon station aboard a starship, as an incidental instead of a maneuver.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Lethal Blows
Talent.Description: The character adds +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury rolls inflicted on opponents.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Doctor
Talent.Description: Once per round, the character may suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Medicine check by one to a minimum of Easy [DI]

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Driver
Talent.Description: Once per round when piloting a vehicle using the Piloting (Planetary) skill, the character may voluntarily suffer two strain to perform any action as a maneuver instead.

Talent.Name: Master Grenadier
Talent.Description: The character decreases the [AD] cost to activate the Blast quality on any weapon he uses by 1 to a minimum of 1. This includes the cost to activate the Blast quality if the weapon misses.

Talent.Name: Master Leader
Talent.Description: Once per round, the character may suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Leadership check by one, to a minimum of Easy [DI].

Talent.Name: Master Merchant
Talent.Description: Before making a check when buying or selling items, the character may choose to suffer two strain. If the check succeeds, he sells the item for 25% more than base cost or buys it for 25% less.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master of Shadows
Talent.Description: Once per round, the character may voluntarily suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of the next Stealth or Skulduggery check by one, to a minimum of Easy [DI]

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Pilot
Talent.Description: Once per round when piloting a starship (a ship piloted using the Piloting [Space] skill), the character may voluntarily suffer two strain to perform any action as a maneuver instead.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Slicer
Talent.Description: Once per round, the character may perform a Master Slicer incidental to suffer two strain and decrease the difficulty of the next Computers or other slicing-related check by one, to a minimum of Easy [DI]

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Starhopper
Talent.Description: Once per round, the character may suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Astrogation check by one, to a minimum of Easy [DI].

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Mental Fortress
Talent.Description: The character may spend one Destiny Point to ignore the effects of ongoing Critical Injuries on any Intellector Cunning-related checks until the end of the encounter. He still suffers from the injury itself

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Brawler
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Brawl or Melee check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Charmer
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Charm or Deception check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Doctor
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Medicine check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Driver
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Piloting (Planetary) or Gunnery check.

Talent.Name: Natural Enforcer
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Coercion or Streetwise check

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Hunter
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Perception or Vigilance check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Leader
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Cool or Leadership check.

Talent.Name: Natural Marksman
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Negotiator
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Cool or Negotiation check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Outdoorsman
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Resilience or Survival check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Pilot
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Piloting (Space) or Gunnery check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Programmer
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Computers or Astrogation check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Rogue
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Skulduggery or Stealth check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Scholar
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Knowledge skill check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Tinkerer
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Mechanics check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Nobody's Fool
Talent.Description: The difficulty of any Charm, Coercion, and Deception checks attempted against the character is upgraded once for each rank of Nobody's Fool.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Outdoorsman
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Outdoorsman from his checks to move through terrain or to manage terrain or environmental effects. Decrease overland travel times by 50% (this does not decrease with additional ranks of Outdoorsman).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Overwhelm Emotions
Talent.Description: more in Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook page 141
Talent.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Overwhelm Defenses
Talent.Description: Upon making an unsuccessful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, the character may spend [AD] [AD] per rank of Overwhelm Defenses. Reduce the defense rating in the defense zone targeted by the attack for the remainder of the encounter by 1 for every [AD] [AD] spent

Talent.Name: Physical Training
Talent.Description: The character adds [BO] per rank of Physical Training to his Athletics and Resilience checks.

Talent.Name: Plausible Deniability
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Plausible Deniability from his Coercion and Deception checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Point Blank
Talent.Description: The character adds 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to one hit of his successful Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) attacks made while at short range or engaged.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Powerful Blast
Talent.Description: The character increases the Blast quality damage dealt by explosives, explosive weapons, and grenades he uses by 1 per rank of Powerful Blast.

Talent.Name: Precise Aim
Talent.Description: Please see page 141 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 31 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook, for details.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Pressure Point
Talent.Description: Please see page 141 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
Talent.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Quick Draw
Talent.Description: Once per round on the character's turn, he may draw or holster an easily accessible weapon or item as an incidental, instead of a maneuver. This talent also reduces the amount of time to draw or stow a weapon that usually requires more than one maneuver to properly prepare or stow, by one maneuver.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Quick Fix
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Agility, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his agility is helping him overcome this challenge.

Talent.Name: Quick Strike
Talent.Description: The character adds [BO] per rank of Quick Strike to his combat checks made against any target that has not yet acted in the encounter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Rapid Reaction
Talent.Description: The character may suffer a number of strain to add an equal number of [SU] to any Vigilance or Cool check to determine Initiative order. The number may not exceed his ranks in Rapid Reaction.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Rapid Recovery
Talent.Description: When the character recovers strain after an encounter has concluded, he recovers one additional strain per rank in Rapid Recovery.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Redundant Systems
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character can take a Redundant Systems action to make a Easy [DI] Mechanics check. If successful, the character may harvest components from a functioning device to repair a broken one, without breaking the functioning device. This allows the character to repair a broken device without having required spare parts, raw materials, or repair kits (the initial check does not suffer penalties for lacking repair kits, either). This only works, however, if the functioning device is at least the same size and technological level as the device being repaired (it's impossible to repair a starship with a blaster pistol).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Researcher
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Researcher from his Knowledge checks. Researching takes 50% less time (this does not increase with additional ranks of Researcher).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Resolve
Talent.Description: When the character suffers strain, he suffers one less strain per rank of Resolve, to a minimum of one. This does not apply to voluntary strain loss.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Respected Scholar
Talent.Description: The character downgrades the difficulty of checks to interact with institutions of learning by one per rank of Respected Scholar.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Scathing Tirade
Talent.Description: The character may take the Scathing Tirade action by making an Average [DI] [DI] Coercion check. For each one enemy within short range suffers one strain. The character can also spend [AD] for every [AD] spent, one target already affected suffers 1 additional strain.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Scathing Tirade (Improved)
Talent.Description: Each enemy affected by Scathing Tirade suffers [SE] on all skill checks for a number of rounds equa to the character's ranks in Coercion; this does not stack with itself.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Scathing Tirade (Supreme)
Talent.Description: The character may voluntarily suffer one strain to perform Scathing Tirade as a maneuver instead of an action.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Second Wind
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, the character may use a Second Wind incidental to recover an amount of strain equal to his ranks in Second Wind.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Selective Detonation
Talent.Description: When using weapons with the Blast quality or explosive devices, the character may spend [AD] to exclude one target that would normally be affected by the explosion. Multiple targets may be excluded in this manner, but the total number may not exceed his ranks in Selective Detonation. The character may also spend [TR] to exclude multiple targets, as long as the total number of targets excluded does not exceed his ranks in Selective Detonation.

Talent.Name: Sense Danger
Talent.Description: Force Talent. Once per game session, the character may remove [SE] [SE] from any one skill check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Sense Emotions
Talent.Description: Please see page 142 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 151 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Shortcut
Talent.Description: During a chase, the character adds [BO] per rank of Shortcut to his checks made to catch or escape an opponent.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Side Step
Talent.Description: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Side Step maneuver to try to avoid incoming ranged attacks. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Side Step. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all ranged combat checks targeting the character a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Situational Awareness
Talent.Description: When in a starship or vehicle with functional corns, allies within short range add [BO] to their Perception and Vigilance checks. Allies within close range add [BO] [BO] instead. This talent operates on planetary scale, not personal scale.

Talent.Name: Sixth Sense
Talent.Description: The character gains + 1 ranged defense.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Skilled Jockey
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Skilled Jockey from his Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) checks

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Skilled Slicer
Talent.Description: When making a Computers check, the character may spend [TR] to gain some measure of control over the target system. Any further Computers checks within this system can be made as maneuvers.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Sleight of Mind
Talent.Description: Force Talent. The character adds [BO] per rank of Sleight of Mind to his Stealth checks unless the being attempting to detect the character is immune to Force Powers.

Talent.Name: Smooth Talker
Talent.Description: When a character first acquires this talent, he chooses one skill Charm, Coercion, Negotiation, or Deception. When making checks with that skill, he may spend [TR] to gain additional [SU] equal to his ranks in Smooth Talker.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Sniper Shot
Talent.Description: Once per round before making a non-thrown ranged attack, the character may perform a maneuver to attempt a Sniper Shot. Sniper Shot increases the maximum range of his ranged weapon up to one range band per rank. For each rank beyond the normal maximum of the weapon, upgrade the difficulty of the check by one (this is in addition to the increased difficulty of the shot due to longer range).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Soft Spot
Talent.Description: After making a successful attack with a non-starship/ vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Cunning to one hit of the successful attack.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Solid Repairs
Talent.Description: Whenever the character repairs hull trauma on a starship or vehicle, he repairs one additional hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Sound Investments
Talent.Description: At the beginning of each game session, the character gains credits equal to his ranks in Sound Investments times 100. How this money is earned is up to the player and CM, and could be actual investments, business dealings, or even a small legal or illegal side business. The GM can also decide that the current events of the adventure may make these funds temporarily unavailable.

Talent.Name: Spare Clip
Talent.Description: The character does not run out of ammo on a [TR] . Items with Limited Ammo quality run out of ammo as normal.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Speaks Binary
Talent.Description: The character grants [BO] per rank of Speaks Binary to any tasks he directs Non-Player Character droids to perform.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stalker
Talent.Description: The character adds [BO] per rank of Stalker to his Coordination and Stealth checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Steely Nerves
Talent.Description: The character may spend one Destiny Point to ignore the effects of ongoing Critical Injuries on any Presence or Willpower related checks until the end of the encounter. He still suffers from the injury itself.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stim Application
Talent.Description: The character may take the Stim Application action. To perform this action, he must have access to drugs, a medpac, or stimpacks. He makes an Average [DI] [DI] Medicine check. If successful, one ally he is engaged with (including himself) increases one characteristic of the character's choice by one for the remainder of the encounter, and suffers four strain. A single character's individual characteristics may each only be increased once by Stim Application during an encounter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stim Application (Improved)
Talent.Description: As an incidental, when performing the Stim Application action, the character may increase the difficulty of the Medicine check to Hard [DI] [DI] [DI] If he does so, the target of the action suffers one strain instead of four.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stim Application (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When performing the Stim Application action, each [TR] may be spent to increase an additional characteristic by one

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stimpack Specialization
Talent.Description: Whenever the character uses a stimpack, the target heals an additional wound per rank of Stimpack Specialization. The sixth stimpack and beyond each day still have no effect.

Talent.Name: Street Smarts
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Street Smarts from his Streetwise and Knowledge (Underworld) checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stroke of Genius
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Intellect, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his intelligence is helping him overcome this challenge.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Strong Arm
Talent.Description: Characters with the Strong Arm talent treat thrown weapons as if they had one step greater range, to a maximum of medium range.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stunning Blow
Talent.Description: When making Melee checks, the character may choose to deal damage as strain instead of wounds. This does not ignore soak.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stunning Blow (Improved)
Talent.Description: When dealing strain damage with Melee or Brawl checks, the character may spend a [TR] result to stagger his target (see page 230) for one round per [TR] spent

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Superior Reflexes
Talent.Description: The character gains + 1 melee defense

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Surgeon
Talent.Description: When this character makes a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals one additional wound per rank of Surgeon.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Swift
Talent.Description: The character does not suffer the penalties for moving through difficult terrain (he moves through it at normal speed, without spending additional maneuvers).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Tactical Combat Training
Talent.Description: Melee and Ranged (Heavy) become career skills.

Talent.Name: Targeted Blow
Talent.Description: On a successful attack during combat with a nonstarship/ vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Agility to one hit of the successful attack.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Technical Aptitude
Talent.Description: For each rank, the character reduces the amount of time needed to complete computer-related tasks by 25% .

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Time to Go
Talent.Description: The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Move maneuver as an incidental to attempt to move into cover or out of the blast range of a weapon or explosion. This may be performed out of turn. This incidental occurs after the character determines he would be hit by the blast, but before damage is applied.

Talent.Name: Time to Go (Improved)
Talent.Description: When activating Time to Co, the character may allow one ally he is engaged with to also perform an out of turn Move maneuver as an incidental to attempt to move into cover or out of the blast range of a weapon or explosion. This incidental occurs after the ally determines he would be hit by the blast, but before damage is applied.

Talent.Name: Tinkerer
Talent.Description: The character makes one piece of equipment more modifiable. He chooses one piece of equipment and increases its number of hard points by one. He can only do this once per piece of equipment, but can modify a number of pieces of equipment equal to his ranks in Tinkerer. If he loses a modified piece of equipment, he may apply Tinkerer to a new one.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Touch of Fate
Talent.Description: Force Talent Once per game session, the character may add [BO] [BO] to any one skill check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Toughened
Talent.Description: Gunner, Infiltrator, Mechanic, Medic, Pilot, Quartermaster, Recruit, Saboteur, Scout, Sharpshooter, Tactician The character increases his wound threshold by two per rank of Toughened.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Tricky Target
Talent.Description: Any vehicle the character pilots counts as having a silhouette one lower than normal when being attacked, to a minimum of 0.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: True Aim
Talent.Description: Once per round, before the character makes a ranged attack, he may perform a True Aim maneuver. By performing this maneuver, the character gains all the benefits for aiming and also upgrades his attack roll once per rank of True Aim.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Uncanny Reactions
Talent.Description: Force Talent. The character adds [BO] per rank of Uncanny Reactions to his Vigilance checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Uncanny Senses
Talent.Description: Force Talent. The character adds [BO] per rank of Uncanny Senses to his Perception checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Unstoppable
Talent.Description: If the percentile roll made when the character receives a Critical Injury is 1 or is reduced to 1, the character does not receive the Critical Injury and suffers none of the effects.

Talent.Name: Utility Belt
Talent.Description: The character may spend one Destiny Point to perform a Utility Belt incidental to produce a previously undocumented—but essential—small tool from his utility belt, satchel, or pockets, with a rarity no greater than (4). This cannot be a weapon unless the weapon has the Limited Ammo 1 quality.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Utinni!
Talent.Description: Please see page 145 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
Talent.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Vehicle Combat Training
Talent.Description: Gunnery and Piloting (Planetary) become career skills.

Talent.Name: Well Rounded
Talent.Description: The character chooses any two skills. They permanently become career skills.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Well Travelled
Talent.Description: Knowledge (Core Worlds) and Knowledge (Outer Rim) become career skills.

Talent.Name: Wheel and Deal
Talent.Description: When he sells legal goods to a reputable merchant or business, the character gains an additional 10% more credits per rank of Wheel and Deal (based on the original selling price of the good or item).

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Works Like A Charm
Talent.Description: Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Presence, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his social ability is helping him overcome this challenge.
